Package examblock.model

Class Venue

Object
Room
Venue
All Implemented Interfaces:
ManageableListItem, StreamManager
public class Venue extends Room
Represents an exam venue, consisting of one or more Rooms.

  • Constructor Details

    • Venue

      public Venue(String id, int roomCount, RoomList rooms, int rows, int columns, int totalDesks, boolean aara, Registry registry)
      Constructs a new Venue object, consisting of one or more Rooms. Where a venue consists of multiple rooms, these are typically contiguous with the room-dividers removed to make a single large venue. Seating plans for venues ARE DIFFERENT to the plans for the individual rooms and SOME joined rooms MAY fit more desks than the individual rooms would have.
      Parameters:
      id - a String identifier for the venue (e.g. "E101" or "L1+L2").
      roomCount - the number of rooms used in the venue; must be one of 1, 2, or 3.
      rooms - the list of room objects - there must be at least one room.
      rows - the number of rows of Desks, rows run across the room, counted front to back.
      columns - the number of columns of Desks, columns run front to back, counted left to right.
      totalDesks - the total available Desks (may be less than rows x columns).
      aara - the venue is to be used for AARA exam sessions.
      registry - the global object registry, needed to resolve textual Subject names

    • Venue

      public Venue(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws IOException, RuntimeException
      Constructs a Subject by reading a description from a text stream
      Parameters:
      br - BufferedReader opened and ready to read from
      registry - the global object registry, needed to resolve textual Subject names
      nthItem - the index number of this serialized object
      Throws:
      IOException - on any read failure
      RuntimeException

  • Method Details

    • streamOut

      public void streamOut(BufferedWriter bw, int nthItem) throws IOException
      Used to write data to the disk.

      The format of the text written to the stream must be matched exactly by streamIn, so it is very important to format the output as described.

      7. W1+W2 (15 desks)
      Room Count: 2, Rooms: S101 S102, Rows: 3, Columns: 5, Desks: 15, AARA: true
      Specified by:
      streamOut in interface StreamManager
      Overrides:
      streamOut in class Room
      Parameters:
      bw - writer, already opened. Your data should be written at the current file position
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      IOException - on any stream related issues

    • streamIn

      public void streamIn(BufferedReader br, Registry registry, int nthItem) throws RuntimeException
      Used to read data from the disk. IOExceptions and RuntimeExceptions must be allowed to propagate out to the calling method, which co-ordinates the streaming. Any other exceptions should be converted to RuntimeExceptions and rethrown.

      For the format of the text in the input stream, refer to the streamOut documentation.
      Specified by:
      streamIn in interface StreamManager
      Overrides:
      streamIn in class Room
      Parameters:
      br - reader, already opened.
      registry - the global object registry
      nthItem - a number representing this item's position in the stream. Used for sanity checks
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - on any logic related issues

    • checkVenueType

      public boolean checkVenueType(boolean aara)
      Check if the venue type is AARA or not. Print the appropriate message if the type doesn't match. Messages are: This is an AARA venue. This is NOT an AARA venue.
      Parameters:
      aara - the venue is to be used for AARA exam sessions.
      Returns:
      True if this venue is the same AARA type as the parameter.

    • willFit

      public boolean willFit(int numberStudents)
      Checks if numberStudents will fit in this venue. Otherwise, print the message: This venue only has (totalDesks) desks, (numberStudents) students will not fit in this venue!
      Parameters:
      numberStudents - the number of students to test if they can fit in this venue.
      Returns:
      True if numberStudents will fit in this venue.
